page.title: 03DHSS - THE WORK
page.content:
The Newcastle Central Office of the DHSS plays a major role in the administration of the social security system.
Much of its work involves large scale operations and affects the lives and well-being of millions of people who are dependent on the benefits it pays out.
It holds the national insurance contribution records for the whole of the U.K. It maintains the records of all retirement and widows' pensions.
It pays child benefit, guardians' allowances and maternity grants. It decides claims and produces statistical information for Government Departments.
